alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Caldwell; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 29 at 8:19PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A DRY FRONT WILL BRING MORE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS ALL OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS WEDNESDAY. A cold front will move west to east into South Central Texas in the pre-dawn hours Wednesday. In the wake of this front gusty west to northwest winds of around 20 mph with gusts over 30 mph will be possible. Humidities could fall into the single digits near the Rio Grande and should bottom out at right around 20 percent over the eastern counties near Highway 77. Fuels remain unusually dry, and this is leading to an active season of wildfires that are difficult to contain. Any outdoor activity that could lead to the development of sparks and resulting wildfire potential is highly discouraged! ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS... * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Bastrop; Caldwell; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee
